citation.article-title: Methylosoma difficile gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel methanotroph enriched by gradient cultivation from littoral sediment of Lake Constance.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Methylosoma [Me.thy.lo.soâ€²ma. N.Gr. prefix methylo referring to methyl groups; Gr. neut. n. soma body; N.L. neut. n. Methylosoma a methyl group (-utilizing) body].
Cells possess a typical membrane system with stacks of intracytoplasmic membranes, typical of type I methanotrophs.
Phylogenetic analysis and morphological characters place the genus close to the genus Methylobacter.
The type and only known species is Methylosoma difficile.
